## ğŸš€ Why Learn Full-Stack Development?

In todayâ€™s tech industry, companies prefer developers who can handle both frontend and backend tasks. Full-stack development makes you:

- **Versatile:** Work on both the client and server sides.
- **Valuable:** Great for startups and freelancing.
- **Self-Sufficient:** Build complete applications independently.
- **Employable:** In-demand skill across the job market.

> ğŸ’¡ Learning full-stack with JavaScript alone (MERN stack) is ideal for beginners since you only need to master one language across the stack.

---

## ğŸ§° Why MERN Stack?

The MERN stack is a powerful combination of technologies for building full-featured web apps:

| Technology | Role            |
|------------|------------------|
| MongoDB    | NoSQL database   |
| Express.js | Web framework    |
| React.js   | Frontend library |
| Node.js    | Backend runtime  |

Benefits:

- Uses JavaScript end-to-end
- Fast, scalable, and easy to learn
- Rich ecosystem and job market support

![MERN Stack Diagram](./images/mern-diagram.png)

## âš™ï¸ Setting Up the Backend (Node + Express + MongoDB)

### 1. Initialize the Backend

```bash
mkdir backend
cd backend
npm init -y
npm install express mongoose cors dotenv
```

Create `.env`:
```env
PORT=5000
MONGO_URI=your_mongodb_connection_string
```

### 2. Basic Express Server

```js
// backend/index.js
const express = require('express');
const mongoose = require('mongoose');
const cors = require('cors');
require('dotenv').config();

const app = express();
app.use(cors());
app.use(express.json());

mongoose.connect(process.env.MONGO_URI)
  .then(() => console.log("MongoDB connected"))
  .catch((err) => console.log(err));

app.get('/', (req, res) => {
  res.send('API is running');
});

app.listen(process.env.PORT, () => {
  console.log(`Server running on port ${process.env.PORT}`);
});
```

### 3. Create Task Schema

```js
// backend/models/Task.js
const mongoose = require('mongoose');

const TaskSchema = new mongoose.Schema({
  title: { type: String, required: true },
  completed: { type: Boolean, default: false }
});

module.exports = mongoose.model('Task', TaskSchema);
```
